job.title: DevSecOps Engineer / Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation.
In Enterprise Connectivity, we create lifetime value for our customers by delivering sticky, connected experiences and solutions that are purposeful and differentiated with simplicity and ingenuity to generate sustainable returns for Ford. We equip the enterprise to derive value from connected vehicle data to generate sustainable savings.
In this position you'll be involved in cross-enterprise initiatives and large-scale vehicle and product launches driving Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) and DevSecOps principles, culture, tools, and processes. We have multiple openings on multiple teams.
We're not just building a product; we're building a community of expertise and engagement around Site Reliability and DevSecOps at Ford.
What You’ll Be Able To Do
Support and develop automation solutions that enable our product teams to build and deploy code efficiently and consistently
Use metrics to validate needs and drive technical decisions
Ensure that Ford systems have reliability and availability appropriate for customer needs
Promote SRE and DevSecOps principles and culture
Encourage tool adoption to help teams with their observability and automation needs
Leverage and recommend cloud technologies that result in fast provisioning and appropriate reliability
The minimum requirements we seek:
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer engineer, software engineering, or a related scientific field
2+ years of work experience implementing and/or supporting cloud-based platforms in an enterprise environment such as: Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Amazon Web Services (AWS), or Microsoft Azure
2+ years of experience building and configuring Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipelines with tools like Jenkins, Tekton, Circle CI, Concourse, or others.
2+ years of experience working with Container environments like Kubernetes, or OpenShift
1+ years of experience with Infrastructure as Code tools like Terraform or Helm
Our preferred requirements:
2+ years of experience using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Dynatrace, DataDog, or others for monitoring, debugging, and troubleshooting distributed systems.
Experience spreading SRE and DevSecOps culture across large organizations
Excellent communication skills
Strong knowledge of cloud infrastructure, application monitoring, and cloud deployment practices
Experience designing, writing, supporting, and troubleshooting software and systems in a distributed environment
Familiarity with eXtreme Programming (XP) practices including Pair/Mob programming and Test-Driven Development
What You’ll Receive In Return
As part of the Ford family, you’ll enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You’ll also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition.
If you have what it takes to help us redefine the future of mobility, we’d love to have you join us.
Visa sponsorship may be available for this position.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.
